title: Akbar Misaghian
text:
Akbar Misaghian (, born May 21, 1953) is an Iranian retired <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach. After retirement, he managed several clubs most notably <a href="F.C.%20Aboumoslem">F.C. Aboumoslem</a>.
Playing career.
Club career.
He started his playing career in 1971 when he played for <a href="Bootan%20Tehran%20F.C.">Bootan Tehran</a> while working for Bootan Gas Company. He then moved to <a href="Mashhad">Mashhad</a> and played for <a href="F.C.%20Aboumoslem">Aboumoslem</a>. In 1976, he left Mashhad for Bandar Anzali to play for <a href="Malavan%20F.C.">Malavan</a> for two seasons. Then he played for <a href="Esteghlal%20F.C.">Esteghlal</a> for three seasons and finally in 1982 he returned to Mashhad and started playing for <a href="F.C.%20Aboumoslem">Aboumoslem</a> once again.
International career.
In 1973 Misaghian was called up to the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national football team</a> selection camp, however failed to impress enough to maintain a place in the squad.
Personal life.
Akbar Misaghian is the father of <a href="Mes%20Kerman%20F.C.">Mes Kerman</a> player <a href="Behtash%20Misaghian">Behtash Misaghian</a>.
